title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-26.4 - Designation of base year rolls
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-26.4 - Designation of base year rolls

State Regulations
(a) The base year roll for each municipality
is the 1989 roll except that for certain municipalities, the base year rolls
are as follows: (1)

For the city of New York, the 1990 assessment roll. (2)

For
the Nassau County roll, the 1990 county assessment roll. (3)

For a homestead assessing unit which uses
the dual tax rate provisions of section 1903 of the RPTL for the first time for
the levy of taxes against the 1990 or 1991 assessment roll, the first roll upon
which dual tax rates are used. (4)

For a newly incorporated municipality, the first available final assessment
roll. If a survey subsequent to the 1992 survey has begun, the determinations
of sample class size, number of intervals, interval sample size, boundary and
content of intervals and supplemental sample shall be made in accordance with
the procedures for such subsequent survey. (5)

For a municipality in which there has
been a change in level of assessment of 15 percent or more on the 1990
assessment roll, the 1990 assessment roll. (6)

For a municipality in which 50 percent or
more of the parcels in roll section 1 and 6 have a change in assessment for
equalization purposes, as reported on part 2 of the 1990 assessor's report, the
1990 assessment roll. (7)

For a
city or town within a county in which 1990 assessment rolls would otherwise be
collected for a majority of the cities or towns, the 1990 assessment
roll. (8)

For a city or town which
meets each of the following criteria, the 1991 assessment roll: (i) there has been a change in level of
assessment of 15 percent or more on the 1991 assessment roll, and/or 50 percent
or more of the parcels in roll sections 1 and 6 have had a change in assessment
for equalization purposes, as reported on part 2 of the 1991 assessor's report; and
(ii)
the city or town provides
all inventory records of assessment roll parcels and sales, and ORPTS has
deemed the records to be of sufficient quality for use in the 1992 market value
survey; and
(iii)
the inventory
records are provided in a format readily usable by ORPTS. (9)

For all other villages, a base year roll
is not designated. (b) Each municipality shall furnish to ORPTS a copy of the final assessment roll
designated as the base year roll for that municipality within 30 days upon
request of ORPTS. (c) Where the
survey base year roll of a prior survey is reused pursuant to this section, the
following procedures shall be followed: (1)

The survey shall be performed on the classified roll prepared for the prior
survey. (2)

The stratification for
the survey shall be the same as was used for the prior survey. (3)

The sample parcels that were appraised
for the prior survey shall be reappraised for the survey. (4)

The data collected for the prior survey
appraisals may be reused when appraising the sample parcels for the
survey. (5)

The supplemental sample
determined for the prior survey shall be reused for the survey. Notes
